column1: When I look at pictures of people of old times
column2: I often think what a curious thing it is that the only apparent difference between them and the people of the present day is to be seen in their clothes.If we could take a dozen or so of ancient Greeks and Romans; some gentlemen and ladies of the middle ages; a party of our great-grandfathers and mothers
column3: and some nice people who are now living in the next street
column4: and were to dress all the women in calico frocks and sun-bonnets
column5: and all the men in linen coats and trousers and broad straw hats
column6: with their hair cut short; and were then to jumble them all up together
column7: and make them keep their tongues quiet
column11: unacquainted with any of the party
